div.head: Advertisement.
div.p: BOccace, the Florentine is the Author of this History, in his last book, De casibus virorum illustrium, & he relateth it upon the credit of his own eyes, and of two old Captaines, Marinus of Bulgaria, and Constantino de la Rocca, who knew her in the Court of Robert King of Naples. I conferred it, upon the first impression in France, with an anciēt Manuscript, & with that which Iohn Ant. Summoto wrot of it.

Jt is a tragicall effect of the inconstancy of Fortune no lesse cunning in her Deceits, than giddy in her Favours. She could not raise this woman from a more despicable degree, nor precipitate her from an higher, To shew, The Ascent to great Prosperities is of Glasse, the Top a Terror, and Descent a Precipice.
